description:
Take this for example:

http://logs.openstack.org/31/111131/2/gate/gate-tempest-dsvm-full/58b9b4d/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz?level=TRACE

In a normal tempest run we generate a lot of errors for "Request returned failure status 404." from glanceclient, in negative tests so this is expected and normal in a tempest run.

On this query:

message:"Request returned failure status 404" AND module:"glanceclient.common.http" AND tags:"screen-n-cpu.txt"

In a week we get nearly 60K hits on that:

http://logstash.openstack.org/#

In a non-tempest scenario, would this really necessitate an error/trace, i.e. does an operator need to be called up in the middle of the night to fix an 'image not found' situation?  The user might have goofed and tried booting an instance with image 'foo'.

So we should just drop this to something less than error, maybe warning to start.
title: Don't trace for image not found from glanceclient

comments.content:
Take this for example:

http://logs.openstack.org/31/111131/2/gate/gate-tempest-dsvm-full/58b9b4d/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz?level=TRACE

In a normal tempest run we generate a lot of errors for "Request returned failure status 404." from glanceclient, in negative tests so this is expected and normal in a tempest run.

On this query:

message:"Request returned failure status 404" AND module:"glanceclient.common.http" AND tags:"screen-n-cpu.txt"

In a week we get nearly 60K hits on that:

http://logstash.openstack.org/#

In a non-tempest scenario, would this really necessitate an error/trace, i.e. does an operator need to be called up in the middle of the night to fix an 'image not found' situation?  The user might have goofed and tried booting an instance with image 'foo'.

So we should just drop this to something less than error, maybe warning to start.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
If I trim down to this trace:

message:"Request returned failure status 404" AND message:"_extract_attributes" AND tags:"screen-n-cpu.txt"

http://logstash.openstack.org/#

That started on 7/28 which is probably due to this change:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/155eeabbfafd4f48b47fea5b403f61a6e5c28426
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/111328
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/111328
Committed: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/commit/?id=ed2aa220aaa19e2692df88710dd721d368859df7
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit ed2aa220aaa19e2692df88710dd721d368859df7
Author: Matt Riedemann <email address hidden>
Date:   Fri Aug 1 08:09:07 2014 -0700

    Only get image location attributes if including locations
    
    Commit 155eeabbfafd4f48b47fea5b403f61a6e5c28426 added 'direct_url' and
    'locations' to the list of attributes to get from an image which makes a
    call back to glance if the attributes aren't on the image, and can
    result in a 404 if they aren't available, which would be in the glance
    v1 API case.
    
    This change simply passes the new include_locations parameter down to
    _extract_attributes so we can do the proper filtering.
    
    Change-Id: I903fa5c781fed52183b340dc3d9bc4b6598b21ce
    Partial-Bug: #1351333
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Seems this is still happening:

http://logs.openstack.org/89/112889/1/gate/check-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full/21fcf50/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz?level=TRACE#_2014-08-14_16_19_47_080

http://logstash.openstack.org/#

398 hits in the last 10 days, definitely better than the 60K hits in 7 days that we were having before.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content: No hits any more. Can we close this?

comments.content: Ack Matthew, i still don't see it.
